TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {57896=Top 10 upsets: A November to remember, 35663=March 1, 2013, 48959=Last meeting: Kentucky 86, Arkansas 63, Jan. 17, 2012, Lexington, Ky. Anthony Davis had 27 points, 14 rebounds and seven blocked shots and the Wildcats raced to a 16-point halftime lead en route to a rout of the Razorbacks. Four other Cats scored in double figures led by Doron Lamb with 14. Terrence Jones had 13 points, nine rebounds and five blocks for UK. Mardracus Wade led four Hogs in double figures with 12 points. Arkansas scored the first points of the second half to close within 14 but never got closer.}
textBeforeTable: ARKANSAS (17-11, 8-7 SEC) Coach: Mike Anderson (35-24 in second season at Arkansas; 235-122 in 11th season overall) Last game: Lost to LSU 65-60 Roster | Stats KENTUCKY (20-8, 11-4 SEC) Coach: John Calipari (122-22 in fourth season at Kentucky; 525-160 in 21st season overall) Last game: Beat Mississippi State 85-55 Roster | Stats KENTUCKY AT ARKANSAS | SATURDAY | 4 P.M. | CBS "Our team's playing better," Calipari said. "We're now going on the road in a hostile environment and this will be the next test for us. Where are we? How far have we come?" Bud Walton Arena will be sold out. The game figures to be physical. In short, Kentucky faces a Hell of a challenge. Now Kentucky hits the road to play a team that Calipari said will play "hand-to-hand
